clinical_study.brief_title: Bandage Contact Lenses Versus Eye Patching of M端ller's Muscle-conjunctival Resection
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Bandage Contact Lenses Versus Eye Patching in Early Postoperative Period of M端ller's Muscle-conjunctival Resection

lead_sponsor.agency: Haydarpasa Numune Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Haydarpasa Numune Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with blepharoptosis who are treated with M端ller's muscle-conjunctival resection (MMCR) may experience postoperative pain and discomfort related to the suture material on the palpebral conjunctiva. This study aims to compare the postoperative subjective complaints, such as pain and discomfort, with a visual analog scale (VAS) and objectively evaluate the cornea with a tear break-up time (TBUT) test and fluorescein staining following MMCR that was managed by either a bandage contact lens (BCL) or eye patching.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with blepharoptosis who are treated with M端ller's muscle-conjunctival resection (MMCR) may experience postoperative pain and discomfort related to the suture material on the palpebral conjunctiva. This study aims to compare the postoperative subjective complaints, such as pain and discomfort, with a visual analog scale (VAS) and objectively evaluate the cornea with a tear break-up time (TBUT) test and fluorescein staining following MMCR that was managed by either a bandage contact lens (BCL) or eye patching.

primary_outcome.description: TBUT score, (the minimum score was 0, and the maximum score was 15)

arm_group.description: A bandage contact lens was applied on the eye at the end of the surgery, and the eye was not covered with a patch.
Antibiotic eye ointment was applied on the eye, and the eye was covered with a patch at the end of the surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who had unilateral ptosis and underwent unilateral MMCR
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients were excluded if they had previous eyelid surgery or had another known eye disease, such as ocular surface disorders, dry eye syndrome.
